
**Hello!** I'm a computer science student currently studying at the <a class="no-underline bg-red-800" style="color: white">University of Wisconsin - Madison</a>. I have experience working in large-scale professional development environments with tools like .NET and C++, as well as experience using rapid development tools like node.js, .NET Core, Angular and React.

- **LinkedIn**: [https://linkedin.com/in/alec-chan](https://linkedin.com/in/alec-chan)
- **GitHub:** [https://github.com/aechan](https://github.com/aechan)
- **Resume:** [View PDF](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OsyFG7J8tiWnmnOVw8fZEB3Ui4He3Ap_/view?usp=sharing)

## Projects

### sync.theater

<blockquote>sync.theater is a web app that allows for realtime synchronized watching of videos over a WebSocket connection. The site is available at <a href="http://sync.theater">http://sync.theater</a> and currently sees around 2000 monthly users.</blockquote>

### FrostSharp

<blockquote>FrostSharp is the first-ever .NET wrapper for <a href="http://po.et">po.et's</a> Frost API. po.et is a blockchain decentralized application for recording proof of content ownership (for copyright disputes etc..) into the blockchain.</blockquote>
## Work Experience

### <img src="https://pbs.twimg.com/profile_images/875416480547917824/R6wl9gWl_400x400.jpg" width="40px"> Microsoft 

<blockquote>At Microsoft, I interned with the Minecraft team at Microsoft and used C++ to modify the Minecraft game engine and add new gameplay features.
Shadowed software engineers and attended workshops to learn about how software is developed in a professional environment and learned about tools used in professional software development like Git and Visual Studio.</blockquote>

### <img src="http://www.intellectualventures.com/images/made/assets_blog/iv_blog_image_600_400_c1_center_center_0_0_1.png" width="40px"/> Invention Science Fund

<blockquote>Prototyped a 3D modelling program in C# on top of the Unity game engine for use with portable 3D scanners.
The prototype is currently being developed into a fully featured product.</blockquote>

### <img src="data:image/png;base64," width="40px"/> Omniwear Haptics

<blockquote>Developed an interop layer between the device driver written in C and managed C# code to be used as a software development kit for developers to control the Omniwear Haptic device from the Unity game engine. Also helped with running user tests of the product.</blockquote>
